dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, no casualties, right? Is that even possible with all that damage?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, no casualties, right? Is that even possible with all that damage?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Despite significant damage, there were no human casualties," the akimat noted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, uh, that's what the official report says, A. Despite, you know, a pretty wild squall wind hitting East Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, uh, that's what the official report says, A. Despite, you know, a pretty wild squall wind hitting East Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A powerful squall wind hit East Kazakhstan Region on the night of April 5. The regional akimat reported on the aftermath of the natural disaster.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A squall? Like, a real squall? Not just, uh, a strong breeze?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A squall? Like, a real squall? Not just, uh, a strong breeze?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, definitely real. April 5th, hit hard, especially Ridder. Wind gusts were, like, seriously destructive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, definitely real. April fifth, hit hard, especially Ridder. Wind gusts were, like, seriously destructive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A powerful squall wind hit East Kazakhstan Region on the night of April 5. The city of Ridder suffered the most damage, where wind gusts reached destructive force, causing serious consequences for urban infrastructure and residential buildings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Destructive? How bad are we talking, exactly?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Destructive? How bad are we talking, exactly?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Um, partial power line damage, roofs torn off residential and utility buildings. Trees down, structures just collapsed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Um, partial power line damage, roofs torn off residential and utility buildings. Trees down, structures just collapsed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to preliminary data, in Ridder, partial damage to power lines was recorded, roofs were torn off residential and utility buildings, trees and various structures were toppled.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa. So, like, people were completely without power then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa. So, like, people were completely without power then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, a lot. About, uh, 1,237 consumers in the DOSAAF area alone, from an emergency shutdown.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, a lot. About, uh, twelve thirty seven consumers in the D O S A A F area alone, from an emergency shutdown.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: About 1,237 consumers in the DOSAAF area were left without electricity due to an emergency shutdown of line L-61 from substation PS-1.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And they just, like, fixed it? Quickly? That seems fast for, you know, such a big outage.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they just, like, fixed it? Quickly? That seems fast for, you know, such a big outage.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, two emergency crews were working, and a third was being assembled. They expected to finish by end of the day.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, two emergency crews were working, and a third was being assembled. They expected to finish by end of the day.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Two emergency crews are working on restoration, and a third is being assembled. Work is expected to be completed by the end of the day," the akimat said in a statement.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, but what about other places? Ridder can't be the only spot, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, but what about other places? Ridder can't be the only spot, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, not at all. Ust-Kamenogorsk, for instance, had the central dome of the "Khalifa Altai" mosque damaged.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, not at all. Ust-Kamenogorsk, for instance, had the central dome of the Khalifa Altai mosque damaged.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Ust-Kamenogorsk, the central dome of the "Khalifa Altai" mosque was damaged, and philanthropists have joined in to help.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A mosque dome? Jeez. And, uh, fires? I heard something about fires.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A mosque dome? Jeez. And, uh, fires? I heard something about fires.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, strong winds and dry weather caused multiple fires. Trash, dry grass, in Ridder and Ust-Kamenogorsk.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, strong winds and dry weather caused multiple fires. Trash, dry grass, in Ridder and Ust-Kamenogorsk.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Due to strong winds and dry weather, multiple fires involving trash and dry grass were recorded across the region. Trash and dry grass caught fire in Ust-Kamenogorsk. Fires were also recorded in Ridder.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But they, like, put them out fast? And still, no one hurt? That just seems…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But they, like, put them out fast? And still, no one hurt? That just seems...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It does sound incredible, doesn't it? But yes, all fires were promptly extinguished by emergency services. No human casualties reported.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It does sound incredible, doesn't it? But yes, all fires were promptly extinguished by emergency services. No human casualties reported.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: All fires were promptly extinguished by the Emergency Department and local authorities, with no casualties reported. ... Despite significant damage, there were no human casualties," the akimat noted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And, like, a roof got torn off a five-story building in Shemonaikha. A recently renovated one, I bet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And, like, a roof got torn off a five-story building in Shemonaikha. A recently renovated one, I bet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Shemonaikha, the roof of a five-story building was torn off over an area of 300 square meters " the building had been renovated just a year ago.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Actually, it was. Just a year ago, 300 square meters of roof. But yeah, still no reported injuries from that either.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Actually, it was. Just a year ago, three hundred square meters of roof. But yeah, still no reported injuries from that either.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Shemonaikha, the roof of a five-story building was torn off over an area of 300 square meters " the building had been renovated just a year ago. ... Despite significant damage, there were no human casualties," the akimat noted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, just property damage then? That's… that's good, I guess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, just property damage then? That's... that's good, I guess.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, significant property damage, but the akimat noted the lack of human casualties as a key point. They're still doing clean-up and damage assessment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, significant property damage, but the akimat noted the lack of human casualties as a key point. They're still doing clean-up and damage assessment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Despite significant damage, there were no human casualties," the akimat noted. ... The akimats are carrying out clean-up, restoration, and damage assessment.
